## WALMART DATA EXPLORATION

This project focused on the analysis of sales in 5 different Walmart's stores.

> My objetive here is to explore the effect of holidays on sales



```{r loading_libraries, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(palmerpenguins)
library(ggplot2)
library(tidyverse)
library(dplyr)
library(lubridate)
library(here)     # referencing files easier
library(skimr)    # simplify data cleaning task (summarizing)
library(janitor)

```



```{r loading_data}
wal_data <- read.csv(file = "walmart_cleaned.csv", header = T)
head(wal_data)
str(wal_data)
```


```{r order_sales}
wal_data %>% group_by(Store) %>% summarise(mean_sales = mean(Weekly_Sales), 
                                           min_sales = min(Weekly_Sales),
                                           max_sales = max(Weekly_Sales)) %>%
  arrange(desc(mean_sales))

wal_data %>% filter(Weekly_Sales < 0)

```




```{r}
non_holiday <- wal_data %>% filter(-Weekly_Sales < 0) %>% select(IsHoliday, Weekly_Sales) %>% 
  filter(IsHoliday == 0)

holiday <- wal_data %>% filter(-Weekly_Sales < 0) %>% select(IsHoliday, Weekly_Sales) %>% 
  filter(IsHoliday == 1)

data_combined <- rbind(non_holiday, holiday) # This command is useful to add new observations, by adding different values from 2 datasets

boxplot(factor(data_combined$IsHoliday), as.numeric(round(data_combined$Weekly_Sales)))

```
